Gensō Senki Kokō no Ryū: Crying Dragon
name: Gensou Senki Kokou no Ryuu: Crying Dragon
overview: Gensou Senki Kokou no Ryuu: Crying Dragon is an unreleased action RPG originally announced by Sega as part of a line-up of early Sega Mega-CD games given to Famitsu and listed in the 28 June 1991 issue, on page 14. It was cancelled for unknown reasons. On November 20th, 2019, a very early prototype of the game was acquired by Andlabs and subsequently dumped. As a sign that the prototype is from very early in development, it is a Sega Mega Drive on a standard Sega development cartridge. The game itself is a side-scrolling action RPG. When you start the game, you'll be thrown into a town. You can move around and press Up to enter a building. Each building has a primitive looking shop which after a brief period of time unceremoniously presents a menu where you can do shop-type things with.
